intro: Cyanothamnus ramosus subsp. anethifolius, commonly known as the anise-leaved bluebottle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, anise-scented leaves. The plant produces striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. It typically grows in coastal areas and is well adapted to sandy soils. This subspecies is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
